column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

There was a larger yarding of 113 trade and export cattle at Powranna on Tuesday with some quality trade cattle available and these sold to strong local butcher competition. Most yearling steers made 310c to 366c and heifers 300c to 352c. There were very few grown steers and heifers.

There was strong competition in the cow sale with best heavy cows making 260c to 282c and leaner 240c to 265c.
Heavy bulls made 210c to 220c/kg live.

Market Reporter Richard Bailey
